intro: Tofieldia tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Tofieldia tenuifolia is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is a perennial plant that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense colonies in suitable environments.
